posts.author: Ethalox
posts.content:
Greetings, one and all.
While I have created my own build for a strength based monk for the Arelith server,
I am keen to see how others might approach it. I have weighed my options of
ways to get a worthy AC, or if to take Epic Damage Reduction, but I would like to simply
see how others might do it. I have surveyed the forum and have not found a strength monk build.

Restrictions: Level 30 cap, 3 "Gifts" (Boons that allow +2 to any stat, post-character creation), 3 consecutive levels must follow the introduction of a new class, no HiPS, no Devastating critical, no RDD, no Shifter.
Intended race: Half-orc.
Preferences: Unarmed, +20 levels of monk, less keen on cleric levels but post your suggestion all the same.

EDIT: No need to outline the entire build, simple gestures, ideas or level distribution is likely sufficient. Post pros and cons, kindly.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With all those restrictions and preferences, you will wind up with a not-very-good build. That's why you can't find one like it anywhere. If you were a little bit flexible with those limitations, I could make a better build for you. For example, RDD would help with STR and AC, but the Sorcerer requirement would cost you some BAB.

Breaking a few of those restrictions, I suggest a Human DEX-based, Monk 20 / Fighter 5 / SD 5. Being DEX-based would give you better AC. Even if HiPS is nerfed, SD would give you Uncanny Dodge (keeping your DEX AC when flat-footed) and access to Epic Dodge, with only 5 levels (Rogue would require 10 levels for the Defensive Roll you need for ED). Four pre-epic levels of Fighter would give you the 6th attack per round, and a well-timed 5th level would give you Epic Weapon Spec.

I'll get into the character build calculator later to see what I can come up with that meets all your limitations.

I have made my own SD monk build that is the -exact- same as yours, too, as a resort, but the last one looks fun and different. I will give it a try when I get home.
I am appriciative for your effort in aiding me
